Job__09.2: Indeed I know it is so, and that man cannot be justified compared with God.
Job__09.3: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one for a thousand.
Job__09.4: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath resisted him, and hath had peace?
Job__09.5: Who hath removed mountains, and they whom he overthrew in his wrath, knew it not.
Job__09.6: Who shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.
Job__09.7: Who commandeth the sun and it riseth not: and shutteth up the stars as it were under a seal:
Job__09.8: Who alone spreadeth out the heavens, and walketh upon the waves of the sea.
Job__09.9: Who maketh <u>Arcturus</u>, and Orion, and Hyades, and the inner parts of the south.
Job__09.10: Who doth things great and incomprehensible, and wonderful, of which there is no number.
Job__09.11: If he come to me, I shall not see him: if he depart I shall not understand.
Job__09.12: If he examine on a sudden, who shall answer him? or who can say: Why dost thou so?
Job__09.13: God, whose wrath no man can resist, and under whom they stoop that bear up the world.
Job__09.14: What am I then, that I should answer him, and have words with him?
Job__09.15: I, who although I should have any just thing, would not answer, but would make supplication to my judge.
Job__09.16: And if he should hear me when I call, I should not believe that he had heard my voice.
Job__09.17: For he shall crush me in a whirlwind, and multiply my wounds even <u>without cause</u>.
Job__09.18: He alloweth not my spirit to rest, and he filleth me with bitterness.
Job__09.19: If strength be demanded, he is most strong: if equity of judgment, no man dare bear witness for me.
Job__09.20: If I would justify myself, my own mouth shall condemn me: if I would shew myself innocent, he shall prove me wicked.
Job__09.21: Although I should be simple, even this my soul shall be ignorant of, and I shall be weary of my life.
Job__09.22: One thing there is that I have spoken, both the innocent and the wicked he consumeth.
Job__09.23: If he scourge, let him kill at once, and not laugh at the pains of the innocent.
Job__09.24: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked, he covereth the face of the judges thereof: and if it be not he, who is it then?
Job__09.25: My days have been swifter than a post: they have fled away and have not seen good.
Job__09.26: They have passed by as ships carrying fruits, as an eagle flying to the prey.
Job__09.27: If I say: I will not speak so: I change my face, and am tormented with sorrow.
Job__09.28: I feared all my works, knowing that thou didst not spare the offender.
Job__09.29: But if so also I am wicked, why have I laboured in vain?
Job__09.30: If I be washed as it were with snow waters, and my hands shall shine ever so clean:
Job__09.31: Yet thou shalt plunge me in filth, and my garments shall abhor me,
Job__09.32: For I shall not answer a man that is like myself: nor one that may be heard with me equally in judgment.
Job__09.33: There is none that may be able to reprove both, and to put his hand between both.
Job__09.34: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me.
Job__09.35: I will speak, and will not fear him: for I cannot answer while I am in fear.
